author: Paul J. Davies
title: Why Barclays’ Promises Are Still for Another Day
text:
If Barclays has the money now for bigger shareholder payouts, why isn’t it making them? The answer shows the risks for investors.
The U.K.-based bank has been under pressure from investors to return more capital after cutting its dividend in half in 2016. The paltry payout remained the same in 2017, the bank announced Thursday, though Chief Executive Jes Staley said it would restore its dividend at the end of 2018. In other words, be patient.
...
